original: imesaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhikkhave, samaṇamalānaṁ samaṇadosānaṁ samaṇakasaṭānaṁ āpāyikānaṁ ṭhānānaṁ duggativedaniyānaṁ appahānā ‘na samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadaṁ paṭipanno’ti vadāmi.🔽Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, matajaṁ nāma āvudhajātaṁ ubhatodhāraṁ pītanisitaṁ.🔽Tadassa saṅghāṭiyā sampārutaṁ sampaliveṭhitaṁ.🔽Tathūpamāhaṁ, bhikkhave, imassa bhikkhuno pabbajjaṁ vadāmi.🔽Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, saṅghāṭikassa saṅghāṭidhāraṇamattena sāmaññaṁ vadāmi.🔽Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, acelakassa acelakamattena sāmaññaṁ vadāmi.🔽Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, rajojallikassa rajojallikamattena sāmaññaṁ vadāmi.🔽Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, udakorohakassa udakorohaṇamattena sāmaññaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: imesam kho aha bhikkhave samaṇa malānam samaṇa dosānam samaṇa kasaṭānam āpāyikānam ṭhānānam duggati vedaniyānam appahānā na samaṇa sāmīci paṭipadam paṭipannaḥ iti vadāmi  seyyathā api bhikkhave matajam nāma āvudha jātam ubhatas dhāram  tat assa saṅghāṭiyā sampārutam sampaliveṭhita  tathūpamā āha bhikkhave imassa bhikkhuno pabbajjam vadāmi  na aha bhikkhave saṅghāṭikassa saṅghāṭi dhāraṇa mattena sāmaññam vadāmi  na aha bhikkhave acelakassa acelaka mattena sāmaññam vadāmi  na aha bhikkhave rajojallikassa rajojallika mattena sāmaññam vadāmi  na aha bhikkhave udakorohakassa udakorohaṇa mattena sāmaññam vadāmi
translated: I say that as long as these corruptions of a contemplative, these stains of a contemplative, these dust and dirt of a contemplative, these diseases of a contemplative, these downfalls of a contemplative, these dangers for a contemplative, these things that defile a contemplative, these unskillful activities of a contemplative, these unbeneficial practices of a contemplative are not abandoned in a contemplative, he is not practicing the way to abandon the corruptions, to uncloud the mind, to make the mind malleable, workable, and radiant, to make it unflagging, imperturbable, and well-released.🔽“Monks, suppose there were a dead snake, and a man came with a basket & a spade. Standing to one side, he’d announce, ‘I’m going to make this dead snake rise up and move around. I’m going to make it do what a living snake does.’🔽Then he’d take the dead snake, put it in the basket, cover it with his cloak, and go off as he had come.🔽I tell you that this is just how it is with the going forth of that monk.🔽I don’t say that the going forth of one who wears a saṅghāṭī is the same as the going forth of one who wears a cloak.🔽I don’t say that the going forth of one who is naked is the same as the going forth of one who is a naked ascetic.🔽I don’t say that the going forth of one who is smeared with filth is the same as the going forth of one who is a filth-smeared ascetic.🔽I don’t say that the going forth of one who plunges into water is the same as the going forth of one who plunges into water.

original: Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlikassa rukkhamūlikamattena sāmaññaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave rukkhamūlikassa rukkhamūlika mattena sāmaññam vadāmi
translated: I say that as long as these corruptions of a contemplative, these stains of a contemplative, these dust and dirt of a contemplative, these diseases of a contemplative, these downfalls of a contemplative, these dangers for a contemplative, these things that defile a contemplative, these unskillful activities of a contemplative, these unbeneficial practices of a contemplative are not abandoned in a contemplative, he is not practicing the way to abandon the corruptions, to uncloud the mind, to make the mind malleable, workable, and radiant, to make it unflagging, imperturbable, and focused on what is skillful.

original: Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, abbhokāsikassa abbhokāsikamattena sāmaññaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave abbhokāsikassa abbhokāsika mattena sāmaññam vadāmi

original: Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, ubbhaṭṭhakassa ubbhaṭṭhakamattena sāmaññaṁ vadāmi.🔽Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, pariyāyabhattikassa pariyāyabhattikamattena sāmaññaṁ vadāmi.🔽Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, mantajjhāyakassa mantajjhāyakamattena sāmaññaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave ubbhaṭṭhakassa ubbhaṭṭhaka mattena sāmaññam vadāmi  na aha bhikkhave pariyāya bhattikassa pariyāya bhattika mattena sāmaññam vadāmi  na aha bhikkhave manta jjhāyakassa manta jjhāyaka mattena sāmaññam vadāmi
